    Subhanallah Wa Bihamdihi Subhanallahil Adzim meaning

    Home » Islamic definitions » Subhanallah Wa Bihamdihi Subhanallahil Adzim meaning

    Subhanallah Wa Bihamdihi Subhanallahil Adzim meaning

    May 20, 2023

    The word Subhanallah wa bihamdihi is one of the greatest acts of worship, and this sentence has a great place in the religion. And you must know the meaning of, so that you repeat it in your heart and on your tongue, so Subhanallah wa bihamdihi subhanallahil adzim meaning that you will have peace of mind in this world and great reward in the hereafter.

    Table of Contents

    • Subhan Allah Wa Bihamdihi Meaning
    • Benefits of saying Subhanallahi Wa Bihamdihi
    • Subhanallah wa bihamdihi subhanallahil adzim Hadith
    • Subhanallah wa bihamdihi subhanallahil adzim 100 times
    • Tasbeeh during and after prayer
    • Tasbeeh in the morning and evening
    • To say when exclamatory
    • Subhanallah wa bihamdihi in Arabic
    • Subhanallah wa bihamdihi adada khalqihi
    • Subhanallah wa bihamdihi subhanallahil adzim and the intentions
    • Subhanallahi Wazifa for Marriage and Job
    • Subhanallahi Wazifa for Rizq
    • What is the difference between Subhanallah and Mashallah?

    Subhan Allah Wa Bihamdihi Meaning

    in English: (Glory be to Allah and all praise is due to him)

    in Arabic:  سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ 

      • The word (Subhan Allah)  Glory be to God: comes from the verb (سبح) glorification and this is that you declare that there is no god but God (the Oneness of God)
      • Wa Bihamdihi (Praise be to Him) : You thank God for the many blessings (that you are grateful to God).

     

    Benefits of saying Subhanallahi Wa Bihamdihi

    • Getting closer to God increases sustenance, peace of mind and wellness, and avoids all evil. There is nothing more beautiful than getting closer to God.
    • Saying the phrase  Subhanallahi Wa Bihamdihi constantly clears sins, for no one knows the number of sins and disobedience he commits every day.
    • It is not only that sins are forgiven, but they have a great reward with God.
      We all know these words are easy to recite, so repeating them every day increases the blessing.

    ”  Book your free trial now from our course Learn Pillars Of Islam “

     

    Subhanallah wa bihamdihi subhanallahil adzim Hadith

    Allah’s Messenger (ﷺ) said, “(The following are) two words (sentences or utterances) that are very easy for the tongue to say, and very heavy in the balance (of reward), and most beloved to the Gracious Almighty (And they are): Subhan Allahi wa bi-hamdihi; Subhan Allahi-l-‘Adhim.” [Sahih al-Bukhari 6682]

    And this is not difficult to remember God, even the remembrances do not take more than five minutes in your day, but it will make a difference in the quality of your life.

    ”  Read also: What is Astaghfirullah Al Azeem meaning?“

     

    Subhanallah wa bihamdihi subhanallahil adzim 100 times

    A Muslim glorifies his Lord in many places that came with evidence either from the Noble Qur’an or the Prophet’s Sunnah. The following is a detailed explanation of these places:

     

    • Tasbeeh during and after prayer

    It is Sunnah for a Muslim to open his prayer with Tasbeeh (glorification), while reading the Qur’an, and after completing the prayer, he glorifies thirty-three times.

     

    • Tasbeeh in the morning and evening

    When a Muslim wakes up and before going to sleep he say:  Subhanallah wa bihamdihi subhanallahil adzim 100 times.

     

    • To say when exclamatory

    If a Muslim hears something unfamiliar, or an action occurs in front of him, or he hears a saying that causes him to be surprised; It was prescribed for him to glorify God Almighty.

    ”  Read also: Meaning of bismillah al rahman al rahim“

     

    Subhanallah wa bihamdihi in Arabic

    سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ العَظِيم

    Glory be to Allah and all praise is due to him, glory be to Allah the great

    It is not difficult to say, why not say it while driving or walking, as it could be the last word you say, so it will intercede for you on the Day of Resurrection.

    The Prophet said that they are two words that are light and easy to read, but they have a great reward with God, so you can write them on a piece of paper and remind yourself every little bit to read them. 

    The Messenger of Allah (AWS) said, “There are two statements that are light for the tongue to remember, heavy in the Scales and are dear to the Merciful:

    “Subhan-Allahi wa bihamdihi, Subhan-Allahil-Azim”

    ”  Read also: What does salam alaikum mean“

     

    Subhanallah wa bihamdihi adada khalqihi

    سبحان الله وبحمده عدد خلقه

    Allah is free from imperfection and I begin with His praise, as many times as the number of His creatures

     

    Subhanallah wa bihamdihi subhanallahil adzim and the intentions

    We always say when doing anything, you renew your intention to God, meaning that before any action you remember God and your intention is to do it for His sake only, and the importance of the intention is that it distinguishes acts of worship from each other and acts of worship from habits.

    The same is the case with the rest of the acts of worship, if the servant remembers his Lord, and his heart is reverent, and his hopes are short, then the intention of worship is in the most perfect manner.

    ”  Read also: What is the meaning of shahada in Islam“

     

    Subhanallahi Wazifa for Marriage and Job

    Who among us does not have problems in marriage and work? And the solution? Getting closer to God is the solution. Remembering God in your day will solve a problem that you thought had no way at all.

    When the remembrance of God comes upon us, blessings and blessings come upon us. Life is nothing but moments, and some of them go without remembrance of God – the Most High – a great loss that the servant does not feel except when meeting God on the Day of Resurrection.

    When you feel in distress, feel Subhanallah wa bihamdihi subhanallahil adzim meaning and say it 100 times after the starting of Fajr in the early morning and before the sunrise.

    Read: Learn more about the common misconception about the real writer of the Quran and the response against all the misunderstandings around the topic.

    Subhanallahi Wazifa for Rizq

    No one has sustenance (Rizq) in this world except by the order of God, whether the sustenance is a job, marriage or a project. When you start your day with the remembrance of God, God reminds you of sustenance ( Rizq).

    So keep reciting the morning and evening remembrances, and always remember God throughout the day, and you will notice that your life has changed for the better.

    ”  Read also: What’s the meaning of Alhamdulillah“

     

    What is the difference between Subhanallah and Mashallah?

    There is a big difference between them, as:

      • Mashallah, you say it when you praise a person, and you wonder at his beauty, for example. It means that this beauty is thanks to God.
      • But Subhanallah wa bihamdihi subhanallahil adzim meaning, you do not praise anyone, but you praise God himself.

     

    Conclusion

    After you know Subhanallah wa bihamdihi subhanallahil adzim meaning, you can now start your day with the remembrance of God, and you will notice that the quality of your life has changed greatly for the better, and that you have become psychologically more comfortable than before.
